server

Interface IServer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProxyServer

    public interface IServer
    Author:
    samwarnick All inputs contain the method they are calling (i.e. /user/login)

    • Method Detail

      • loginUser

        java.lang.String loginUser(UserLoginInput input)
                           throws ServerException
        Logs the caller into the server, and sets their catan.user HTTP cookie.
        Parameters:
        input - contains username and password
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        username AND password != null
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response with “Success” in the body.
        2. The HTTP response headers set the catan.user cookie to contain the identity of the logged­in player.

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error message.

      • registerUser

        java.lang.String registerUser(UserRegisterInput input)
                              throws ServerException
        Creates a new user account and logs the caller into the server as the new user, and sets their catan.user HTTP cookie.
        Parameters:
        input - contains username, password, and username
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        username and password != null AND username not in use
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. A new user account has been created with the specified username and password.
        2.The server returns an HTTP 200 success response with “Success” in the body.
        3. The HTTP response headers set the catan.user cookie to contain the identity of the logged­in player.

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error message.

      • listGames

        java.util.List<GameModel> listGames(GamesListInput input)
                                    throws ServerException
        Returns information about all of the current games on the server.
        Parameters:
        input -
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        none
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response.
        2. The body contains a JSON array containing a list of objects that contain information

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error message.

      • createGame

        GameModel createGame(GamesCreateInput input)
                     throws ServerException
        Creates a new game on the server.
        Parameters:
        input - contains gameName, randomTiles, randomNumbers, randomPorts
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        gameName != null AND randomTiles, randomNumbers, randomPorts valid boolean
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. A new game with the specified properties has been created
        2. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response.
        3. The body contains a JSON object describing the newly created game

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • joinGame

        java.lang.String joinGame(GamesJoinInput input)
                          throws ServerException
        Adds the player to the specified game and sets their catan.game cookie.
        Parameters:
        input - contains user
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. The user has previously logged in to the server (i.e., they have a valid catan.user HTTP cookie).
        2. The player may join the game because:
      • a. They are already in the game, OR
      • b. There is space in the game to add a new player
        3. The specified game ID is valid
        4. The specified color is valid (red, green, blue, yellow, puce, brown, white, purple, orange)
        • Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response with “Success” in the body.
        2. The player is in the game with the specified color (i.e. calls to /games/list method will show the player in the game with the chosen color).
        3. The server response includes the “Set­cookie” response header setting the catan.game HTTP cookie

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • saveGame

        boolean saveGame(GamesSaveInput input)
                 throws ServerException
        This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Parameters:
        input - contains gameID and filename
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. The specified game ID is valid
        2. The specified file name is valid (i.e., not null or empty)
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response with “Success” in the body.
        2. The current state of the specified game (including its ID) has been saved to the specified file name in the server’s saves/ directory

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • loadGame

        GameModel loadGame(GamesLoadInput input)
                   throws ServerException
        This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Parameters:
        input - contains filename
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        A previously saved game file with the specified name exists in the server’s saves/ directory.
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response with “Success” in the body.
        2. The game in the specified file has been loaded into the server and its state restored (including its ID).

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • getGameModelVersion

        GameModel getGameModelVersion(GameModelVersionInput input)
                              throws ServerException
        Returns the current state of the game in JSON format.

        In addition to the current game state, the returned JSON also includes a “version” number for the client model. The next time /game/model is called, the version number from the previously retrieved model may optionally be included as a query parameter in the request (/game/model?version=N). The server will only return the full JSON game state if its version number is not equal to N. If it is equal to N, the server returns “true” to indicate that the caller already has the latest game state. This is merely an optimization. If the version number is not included in the request URL, the server will return the full game state.
        Parameters:
        input - contains user, version number
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        The caller has previously logged in to the server and joined a game 2. If specified, the version number is included as the “version” query parameter in the request URL, and its value is a valid integer.
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response.
        2. The response body contains JSON data
      • a. The full client model JSON is returned if the caller does not provide a version number, or the provide version number does not match the version on the server
      • b. “true” (true in double quotes) is returned if the caller provided a version number, and the version number matched the version number on the server

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • resetGame

        GameModel resetGame(GameResetInput input)
                    throws ServerException
        Clears out the command history of the current game.

        For the default games created by the server, this method reverts the game to the state immediately after the initial placement round. For user ­created games, this method reverts the game to the very beginning (i.e., before the initial placement round).

        This method returns the client model JSON for the game after it has been reset.
        Parameters:
        input - contains user
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        The caller has previously logged in to the server and joined a game (i.e., they have valid catan.user and catan.game HTTP cookies).
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The game’s command history has been cleared out
        2. The game’s players have NOT been cleared out
        3. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response.
        4. The body contains the game’s updated client model JSON

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • getGameCommands

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGameCommands(GameCommandsGetInput input)
                                                 throws ServerException
        Returns a list of commands that have been executed in the current game.

        This method can be used for testing and debugging. The command list returned by this method can be passed to the /game/command (POST) method to re­execute the commands in the game. This would typically be done after calling /game/reset to clear out the game’s command history. This is one way to capture the state of a game and restore it later. (See the /games/save and /games/load methods which provide another way to save and restore the state of a game.)

        For the default games created by the server, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed after the initial placement round. For user­created games, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed since the very beginning of the game (i.e., before the initial placement round).
        Parameters:
        input - contains user
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        The caller has previously logged in to the server and joined a game (i.e., they have valid catan.user and catan.game HTTP cookies).
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response.
        2. The body contains a JSON array of commands that have been executed in the game. This command array is suitable for passing back to the /game/command [POST] method to restore the state of the game later (after calling /game/reset to revert the game to its initial state).

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • postGameCommands

        GameModel postGameCommands(GameCommandsPostInput input)
                           throws ServerException
        Executes the specified command list in the current game.

        This method can be used for testing and debugging. The command list returned by the /game/command [GET] method is suitable for passing to this method.

        This method returns the client model JSON for the game after the command list has been applied.
        Parameters:
        input - contains user and commands
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        The caller has previously logged in to the server and joined a game (i.e., they have valid catan.user and catan.game HTTP cookies).
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The passed­in command list has been applied to the game.
        2. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response.
        3. The body contains the game’s updated client model JSON

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

      • changeLogLevel

        boolean changeLogLevel(UtilChangeLogLevelInput input)
                       throws ServerException
        Sets the server’s logging level.
        Parameters:
        input -
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        The caller specifies a valid logging level. Valid values include: 
        SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST
        Postcondition:
        VALID:
        1. The server returns an HTTP 200 success response with “Success” in the body.
        2. The Server is using the specified logging level

        FAIL:
        The server returns an HTTP 400 error response, and the body contains an error

        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not

        Postcondition:
        The chat contains your message at the end

      • acceptTrade

        GameModel acceptTrade(AcceptTradeInput input)
                      throws ServerException
        Player gets excited and accepts trade, or not. Either is fine.
        Parameters:
        input - contains willAccept boolean
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. You have been offered a domestic trade
        2. To accept the offered trade, you have the required resources
        Postcondition:
        1. If you accepted, you and the player who offered swap the specified resources
        2. If you declined no resources are exchanged
        3. The trade offer is removed

      • discardCards

        GameModel discardCards(DiscardCardsInput input)
                       throws ServerException
        Player whimpers as they discard cards
        Parameters:
        input - contains bank of cards to discard
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        The status of the client model is 'Discarding'
        You have over 7 cards
        You have the cards you're choosing to discard.
        Postcondition:
        1. You gave up the specified resources
        2. If you're the last one to discard, the client model status changes to 'Robbing'

      • rollNumber

        GameModel rollNumber(RollNumberInput input)
                     throws ServerException
        Player rolls load dice, if they are a no good cheater
        Parameters:
        input - contains number
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        It is your turn
        The client model’s status is ‘Rolling’
        Postcondition:
        The client model’s status is now in ‘Discarding’ or ‘Robbing’ or ‘Playing’

      • buildRoad

        GameModel buildRoad(BuildRoadInput input)
                    throws ServerException
        Player builds a road
        Parameters:
        input - contains free and roadLocation
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Postcondition:
        1. You lost the resources required to build a road (1 wood, 1 brick; 1 road)
        2. The road is on the map at the specified location
        3. If applicable, “longest road” has been awarded to the player with the longest road

      • buildSettlement

        GameModel buildSettlement(BuildSettlementInput input)
                          throws ServerException
        Player builds a settlement
        Parameters:
        input - contains free and vertexLocation
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. The settlement location is open
        2. The settlement location is not on water
        3. The settlement location is connected to one of your roads except during setup
        4. You have the required resources (1 wood, 1 brick, 1 wheat, 1 sheep; 1 settlement)
        5. The settlement cannot be placed adjacent to another settlement
        Postcondition:
        1. You lost the resources required to build a settlement (1 wood, 1 brick, 1 wheat, 1 sheep; 1 settlement)
        2.The settlement is on the map at the specified location

      • buildCity

        GameModel buildCity(BuildCityInput input)
                    throws ServerException
        Player builds a City
        Parameters:
        input - contains vertexLocation
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. The city location is where you currently have a settlement
        2. You have the required resources (2 wheat, 3 ore; 1 city)
        Postcondition:
        1. You lost the resources required to build a city (2 wheat, 3 ore; 1 city)
        2. The city is on the map at the specified location
        3. You got a settlement back

      • offerTrade

        GameModel offerTrade(OfferTradeInput input)
                     throws ServerException
        Player offers a trade
        Parameters:
        input - contains offer and receiver
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        You have the resources you are offering
        Postcondition:
        The trade is offered to the other player (stored in the server model)

      • maritimeTrade

        GameModel maritimeTrade(MaritimeTradeInput input)
                        throws ServerException
        Player trades with the salty sea
        Parameters:
        input - contains TradeRation, inputResource, and outputResource
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. You have the resources you are giving
        2. For ratios less than 4, you have the correct port for the trade
        Postcondition:
        The trade has been executed (the offered resources are in the bank, and the requested resource has been received)

      • robPlayer

        GameModel robPlayer(RobPlayerInput input)
                    throws ServerException
        Player robs another helpless victim
        Parameters:
        input - contains location and victim
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. The robber is not being kept in the same location
        2. If a player is being robbed (i.e., victimIndex != ­1), the player being robbed has resource cards
        Postcondition:
        1. The robber is in the new location
        2. The player being robbed (if any) gave you one of his resource cards (randomly selected)

      • finishTurn

        GameModel finishTurn(FinishTurnInput input)
                     throws ServerException
        Player takes their sweet time and finishes their turn, finally
        Parameters:
        input -
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        none
        Postcondition:
        1. The cards in your new dev card hand have been transferred to your old dev card hand
        2. It is the next player’s turn

      • buyDevCard

        GameModel buyDevCard(BuyDevCardInput input)
                     throws ServerException
        Player shows their wealth by purchasing a development card to the awe of the other players
        Parameters:
        input -
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. You have the required resources (1 ore, 1 wheat, 1 sheep)
        2. There are dev cards left in the deck
        Postcondition:
        You have a new card
      • If it is a monument card, it has been added to your old devcard hand
      • If it is a non­monument card, it has been added to your new devcard hand (unplayable this turn)

      • playSoldier

        GameModel playSoldier(PlaySoldierInput input)
                      throws ServerException
        Player plays soldier card
        Parameters:
        input - contains location and victimIndex
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. The robber is not being kept in the same location
        2. If a player is being robbed (i.e., victimIndex != ­1), the player being robbed has resource cards
        Postcondition:
        1. The robber is in the new location
        2. The player being robbed (if any) gave you one of his resource cards (randomly selected)
        3. If applicable, “largest army” has been awarded to the player who has played the most soldier cards
        4. You are not allowed to play other development cards during this turn (except for monument cards, which may still be played)

      • playYearOfPlenty

        GameModel playYearOfPlenty(PlayYearOfPlentyInput input)
                           throws ServerException
        Player plays soldier card
        Parameters:
        input - contains two resources
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        The two specified resources are in the bank
        Postcondition:
        You gained the two specified resources

      • playRoadBuilding

        GameModel playRoadBuilding(PlayRoadBuildingInput input)
                           throws ServerException
        Player plays soldier card
        Parameters:
        input - contains two edge locations
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        1. The first road location (spot1) is connected to one of your roads.
        2. The second road location (spot2) is connected to one of your roads or to the first road location (spot1)
        3. Neither road location is on water
        4. You have at least two unused roads
        Postcondition:
        1. You have two fewer unused roads
        2. Two new roads appear on the map at the specified locations
        3. If applicable, “longest road” has been awarded to the player with the longest road

      • playMonopoly

        GameModel playMonopoly(PlayMonopolyInput input)
                       throws ServerException
        Player plays soldier card
        Parameters:
        input - contains resource
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        General preconditions
        Postcondition:
        All of the other players have given you all of their resource cards of the specified type

      • playMonument

        GameModel playMonument(PlayMonumentInput input)
                       throws ServerException
        Player plays soldier card
        Parameters:
        input -
        Throws:
        ServerException - if status is not 
        HTTP_OK
        Precondition:
        You have enough monument cards to win the game (i.e., reach 10 victory points)
        Postcondition:
        You gained a victory point
